City Council
============





City Council meets every third Tuesday of the month at 6:00 PM. in the City of Fulshear Municipal Complex located at 6611 W Cross Creek Bend Lane, Fulshear TX 77441.
Please check the calendar
to verify meeting dates and locations. Meetings are open to the public. For more information, please contact the City Secretary's office at (281) 346-1796.

* [City Council Agendas, Packets, & Minutes](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2ffulsheartexas.granicus.com%2fViewPublisher.php%3fview_id%3d1&____isexternal=true)
* [Archived City Council Agendas, Packets, & Minutes](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/?splash=https%3a%2f%2ffulshear.novusagenda.com%2fagendapublic%2fmeetingsgeneral.aspx&____isexternal=true)

[District Ma](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/about-us/fulshear-maps)

Fulshear Strategic Plan
City Council adopted a Strategic Plan on March 20, 2018, outlining the vision, mission, and strategic priorities for the City of Fulshear.



Mayor

### Don McCoy, Mayor

**TERM: June 2024 - May 2026
![councilmember](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/770/638554169534970000)**
[Email Mayor](mailto:dmccoy@fulsheartexas.gov)
[McCoy](mailto:dmccoy@fulsheartexas.gov)
, dmccoy@fulsheartexas.gov

Don McCoy was elected Mayor in 2024.
Don also serves as the president of the Fulshear Regional Chamber FOR Commerce since its inception in late 2013.

Don has been a driving force behind its growth to over 500 business members. Don’s passion and dedication shine through in everything he does, consistently striving to make a significant impact. With over 40 years of experience, Don is a seasoned marketing professional known for his visionary ideas.

Don holds a degree in Management and Marketing, with a minor in Spanish, from Stephen F. Austin State University. A devoted Christian, he has served as a Deacon and Sunday School Director at Second Baptist Church 1463.

He’s an active member of the Brazos River Rotary Club and the Fulshear Simonton Lions Club. Fluent in Spanish and well-traveled, Don has lived in Venezuela, Mexico, England, Scotland, and Iran, and has explored the world extensively. His favorite sayings, “I have another great idea” and “Be significant and keep leading,” perfectly encapsulate his dynamic and inspirational approach to life and work.

Mayor Pro-Tem, District 1

### Sarah B. Johnson, Mayor Pro-Tem, Councilmember District 1

![](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/468/638302896179870000)

**TERM: May 2025 - May 2027**
[Email Councilmember Johnson](mailto:sjohnson@fulsheartexas.gov)
, sjohnson@fulsheartexas.gov

Sarah B. Johnson was appointed by City Council on August 3, 2021, to serve as the District 1 City Council Member.

She is a military veteran who served nine years in the Royal Australian Air Force,

Sarah moved to Fulshear, Texas, with her husband, U.S. Army veteran Levi and children in 2012. She proudly became a citizen of the United States in 2014. Today, Sarah works for bp in continuous improvement and business transformation.

At-Large Position 1

### Camron K. Miller, Councilmember At-Large

**TERM: June 2025 - May 2027**

[Email Councilmember](mailto:cmiller@fulsheartexas.gov)
[Miller](mailto:cmiller@fulsheartexas.gov)
, cmiller@fulsheartexas.gov

![](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/1020/638865448917570000)

Camron Miller was elected to the At-Large position on Fulshear City Council on June 7, 2025, and was sworn in on June 17.

Camron grew up in Millersburg, OH, but has spent the greater part of the last 25 years in Texas thanks to a very rewarding career in the energy industry.  Camron holds a M.S. degree in Petroleum Geology and currently serves as a Principal Geologist for SLB’s Asset Performance Solutions Group, which manages ~200,000 bbls of oil per day from assets around the globe.
With his family, Camron moved to Fulshear in 2013. Two of his four children are students at Texas A&M University in College Station, while the other two are in kindergarten and preschool in Katy ISD.  His fiancée, Julie, is a Dental Hygienist at Fort Bend Periodontics and Implantology in Sugar Land, TX.
Camron has served for over two years on the Board of Directors for the Fort Bend Subsidence District, representing the City of Fulshear, and provided technical leadership to the Science & Research Committee there.  He is committed to keeping Fulshear safe and beautiful, amplifying the voices of those who feel underrepresented, proactively building infrastructure, and mitigating water-related issues in the area.

At-Large Position 2

### Jason Knape, Councilmember At-Large

![Councilmember Jason Knape](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/470/638302896193430000)

**TERM: May 2024 - May 2026**
[Email Councilmember Knape](mailto:jknape@fulsheartexas.gov)
, jknape@fulsheartexas.gov

Jason Knape was elected as At-Large Councilmember in the May 7, 2022 election and was sworn in on May 17.

Jason was born and raised in Texas and moved to Fulshear in 2016. He received his Bachelor's degree in Mathematics from the University of Texas at Austin.

Currently, he is the Senior Director, Customer Success for PROS Inc., a software company headquartered in Houston, TX, that provides an AI-based platform that optimizes every shopping and selling interaction. He and his family are members of St. Faustina Catholic Church in Fulshear, where he is a member and Deputy Grand Knight of Knights of Columbus Council #16103.

Jason and his wife Kristin have four wonderful children enrolled in local Katy ISD schools.

District 2

### Patrick Powers, Councilmember District 2

![](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/762/638527518472230000)

**TERM: May 2024 - May 2026**
[Email Councilmember](mailto:ppowers@fulsheartexas.gov)
[Powers](mailto:ppowers@fulsheartexas.gov)
, ppowers@fulsheartexas.gov

Patrick Powers is a Vice President at Michel, Gray & Rogers LLP, a renowned law firm specializing in property tax appeals. He earned his degree in Chinese Language & Literature from the University of California, Riverside, where he distinguished himself academically. Patrick’s passion for cross-cultural understanding led him to be awarded the U.S. Department of State’s Benjamin A. Gilman International Scholarship, which facilitated a transformative academic year at China’s esteemed Peking University.

Patrick, driven by his passion for service, currently serves as the President-Elect at the Brazos River Rotary Club, where he actively contributes to community development initiatives. Above all, Patrick cherishes his role as a dedicated family man to his wife, Victoria, and their two-year-old daughter, Evelyn. Their love and support are the cornerstone of his life, guiding him in all his endeavors.

District 3

### Christina Baron, Councilmember District 3

![Councilmember Baron](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/476/638302910518530000)

**TERM: May 2024 - May 2026**
[Email Councilmember Baron](mailto:cbaron@fulsheartexas.gov)
, cbaron@fulsheartexas.gov

Christina Baron was appointed by City Council on September 5, 2023, to serve as the District 3 City Council Member.

Christina grew up in a small, rural town in Southeastern Missouri. She holds a Bachelor’s of Science in geology from Missouri State University and a Master’s of Science in geology from Colorado School of Mines. She worked for over a decade as a geoscientist in the oil and gas industry.

Christina moved to Fulshear in 2021 with her husband, Alex, and is currently a stay-at-home mom to her 2 preschool-aged sons. She teaches group fitness classes at the Katy-area YMCA’s and is an active member and former board member of MOMS Club of Fulshear, a local non-profit that helps support moms

District 4

### Richard Russell Councilmember District 4

**TERM: May 2025 - May 2027**
[Email Councilmember Russell](mailto:rrussell@fulsheartexas.gov)
, rrussell@fulsheartexas.gov
![](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/1016/638841877503670000)

Richard Russell was elected to the Fulshear City Council in 2025. A proud naturalized U.S. citizen originally from Venezuela, Richard became a citizen in 1988 and later served honorably in the United States Air Force. He brings a strong background in business, logistics, and public service to his role on the council.

Richard studied Accounting at Georgia State University and Business Administration at the University of Phoenix. He was a small business owner from 2014 to 2021 and has worked in the supply chain field since 2007. His experience spans operations, planning, and global logistics management.

A resident of Fulshear since 2022, Richard is committed to supporting responsible growth, enhancing infrastructure, and promoting transparency in city government. He and his family are actively involved in the local community and schools, and he is honored to serve District 4.

District 5

### Abhijeet Utturkar, Councilmember District 5

![Councilmember Utturkar](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/home/showpublishedimage/478/638302911321030000)

****TERM: May 2025 - May 2027****
[Email Councilmember Utturkar](https://www.fulsheartexas.gov/about-us/city-leadership/autturkar@fulsheartexas.gov)
, autturkar@fulsheartexas.gov

*Council Liaison to City of Fulshear Development Corporation (Type A)*

Abhi grew up in India. He obtained a Master's Degree in Mechanical Engineering at Oklahoma State University, Stillwater, OK in 2002, and became a US Citizen in 2017. After living in Oklahoma for nearly 18 years, he moved to Fulshear, TX with his family.

He has served as a member of the Zoning Board of Adjustments (ZBA) at the City of Fulshear (2022-2023) and has held various positions as a member of several city committees and boards at City of Owasso, OK (2013 - 2021). He currently works as Chief Engineer at Sempra Infrastructure in Houston, TX. He holds a professional engineer license in several states, including Texas.
